xxl.core.pipes.sources
Interface Source<O>

All Superinterfaces:
MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, Node
All Known Subinterfaces:
Pipe<I,O>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBufferPipe, AbstractGrouper, AbstractGrouper.Group, AbstractPipe, AbstractSource, AbstractTemporalPipe, AbstractTemporalSource, AbstractTimeStampPipe, AbstractTimeStampSource, Aggregator, BlockBasedBufferPipe, BufferPipe, Coalesce, CountBasedWindow, Counter, CursorSource, Dropper, Enumerator, Filter, HashGrouper, HeapSorter, HeartbeatTests.TimeStampHBSource, HighwaySource, IdentityPipe, IndexJoin, Join, Logger, Mapper, MultiWayEquiJoin, NestedTemporalWindow, NEXMarkGeneratorSource, Permutator, PlanMigration.ReferencePointSplit, PlanMigration.ReferencePointUnion, PredicateGrouper, PredicateSorter, RandomNumber, ReservoirSampler, Sampler, Split, SyncTimeStampSource, TemporalAggregator, TemporalDifference, TemporalDistinct, TemporalFilter, TemporalGroupAndAggregator, TemporalJoin, TemporalMapper, TemporalUnion, TemporalWindow, TimeGranularity, TimeStampCursorSource, TimeStampIdentityPipe, Union
public interface Source<O>
extends Node

Our framework for query processing is based on dataflow graphs, therefore it consists of three fundamental types of components: sources, operators, and sinks. Sources represent the initial components of a query graph, whereas sinks act as the terminal components. Operators can only appear 'inside' a query graph.

This interface models an arbitrary active source in a query graph. A source can be accessed with a publish-/subscribe mechanism. Sinks (interface Sink) can be subscribed to a source. If a source is opened, it continuously delivers its elements to all subscribers until it gets closed.
An operator (interface Pipe) within a query graph extends the interfaces Source and Sink, because on the hand, it receives elements from its underlying sources and on the other hand, it transfers its results to its subscribed sinks.

Since:
1.1

Method Detail

open

void open()
          throws SourceIsClosedException
Opens the source and starts processing. This method should be implemented in an idempotent manner.

Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

close

void close()
Closes this source. All resources allocated by this source should be released.

transfer

void transfer(O o)
Transfers the given element to all subscribed sinks.

Parameters:
o - The element to be transferred.

subscribe

boolean subscribe(Sink<? super O> sink,
                  int sinkID)
                  throws SourceIsClosedException
Subscribes the specified sink with the given ID to this source. The ID is necessary to distinguish different sources when using operators based on multiple inputs.
The sink and its corresponding ID have to be stored in an internal datastructure by this source and each sink can be accessed by an index.

Parameters:
sink - The sink to be subscribed.
sinkID - The ID which will be passed when transfering a new object to the specified sink.
Returns:
Returns true, if the subscribe operation has been successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

unsubscribe

boolean unsubscribe(Sink<? super O> sink,
                    int sinkID)
                    throws SourceIsClosedException
The given sink cancels its subscription. The registered sink with the given ID will not be informed about new elements any longer. If a sink is subscribed plurally, i.e. the same sink is subscribed with different IDs, only the subscription concerning the specified ID will be removed.

Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
sinkID - The ID of the sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
Returns:
Returns true, if the unsubscribe operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

getSink

Sink<? super O> getSink(int index)
                        throws SourceIsClosedException,
                               IllegalArgumentException,
                               IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns a reference to a Sink belonging to the specified index. A sink was associated with this index when it called the subscribe method.

Parameters:
index - The index used to access subscribed sinks within this source.
Returns:
The sink belonging to the specified index.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
IllegalArgumentException - If no sinks have been subscribed.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index does not exist.

getSinkID

int getSinkID(Sink<? super O> sink)
              throws SourceIsClosedException,
                     IllegalArgumentException
Returns the ID of the sink, which has initially been specified when the given sink got subscribed to this source.

Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription ID should be detected.
Returns:
The first matching ID of the specified sink.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified sinks is not subscribed.

getNoOfSinks

int getNoOfSinks()
                 throws SourceIsClosedException
Returns the number of sinks that are currently subscribed to this source.

Returns:
The number of sinks.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

isOpened

boolean isOpened()
Tests if this source is already opened.

Returns:
Returns true, if the source is already opened, otherwise false.

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Detects if this source has already been closed.

Returns:
Returns true, if the source has already been closed, otherwise false.
